answerText: hope[10] The speaker of one Dickinson poem notices "The eyes beside had wrung them dry" after the speaker heard this insect buzz "when I died."
heading: ACF Fall |2008 | Caltech + Langston | 4 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Identify these words appearing in the poetry of Emily Dickinson,  [10] One poem describes this as being "the thing with feathers- / That perches in the soul- / And sings the tune without the words- / And never stops at all."
